name: St. Bernard of Clairvaux
summary: Bernard of Clairvaux was a French Cistercian monk, abbot, and theologian who became one of the most influential churchmen of the 12th century. He founded the Abbey of Clairvaux and was a key figure in the Cistercian reform movement. He played a crucial role in the Second Crusade, the resolution of papal schisms, and the condemnation of Peter Abelard. He is venerated as a Doctor of the Church and is known for his mystical writings, particularly on the love of God.
keyQuotes: The measure of love is to love without measure.
